sentences.en: Cellular phones are inherently insecure, as anyone can listen to and record conversations.
sentences.cn: 手机天生就不安全，因为任何人都可以听到并录下谈话。

sentences.en: Certain colors, due to pigment ingredients, may inherently have very poor sulfuric acid resistance.
sentences.cn: 某些颜料, 由于色素组成成份的性质而导致耐酸性很差.

sentences.en: Mechanical switching is inherently slow and frequently unreliable.
sentences.cn: 机械开关速度有一种固有的缓慢性,而且经常不可靠.

sentences.en: Most of an individual's genes, however, are inherently good.
sentences.cn: 然而人类个体的基因生来就是正常的,很少发生突变(变异).

sentences.en: Most people don't like change, so roll - outs are inherently a tricky business.
sentences.cn: 很多人并不喜欢改变, 因此,改版必定是件冒点风险的事情.
石油勘探本来就是带有概率性的.

sentences.en: TDMA - based MAC protocol is inherently collision free but it has poor scalability.
sentences.cn: 基于TDMA的MAC协议具有固有的节能特性,但是其可扩展性较差.

sentences.en: The profit motive is inherently at odds with principles of fairness and equity.
sentences.cn: 盈利动机天生就与公平和公正的原则相抵触。

sentences.en: There is nothing inherently improbable in the idea.
sentences.cn: 这个想法本身没什么不可能的.

sentences.en: They also resort to theories, predictions, and intuitions that are inherently incapable of exact proof.
sentences.cn: 法官还借助理论 、 预测和直觉,这些在实际举证中是不可能得到的.

sentences.en: Trade is inherently evil but is justified by the good of the public.
sentences.cn: 商业本来是一件坏事,但因为对公众是好事而得到肯定.

sentences.en: War is inherently a dirty business.
sentences.cn: 战争与生俱来就是肮脏的。

sentences.en: Weighing is inherently a more positive and accurate method.
sentences.cn: 称重法从根本上说是一种更可靠和更精确的方法.

sentences.en: Yet the concept that light is somehow inherently oscillatory has persisted throughout this transition period.
sentences.cn: 但是光本来是某种振动这一概念在过渡时期里始终保持着.

words.tran_cn: 固有的；内在的；与生俱来的，遗传的
固有；生来即存在；本质上即属
